page.title: 10Pedestrianisation
page.content: Controversy rages over the introduction of pedestrianisation into part of the town shopping area. The Barru and district news reports comment, most of it adverse, about this move on the part ofthe Council.. Only 10 out of 89 traders interviewed felt that the scheme had brough benefit to their businesses. For every shopper who now feels safe in Holon road, there are 2 or 3 who do not. When 77 people were interviewed only 22 said they felt safer. Pedestrians felt they were less sae because of the unexpected appearance of buses and taxis in the street. A school poll conductd on a busy shopping day found that while many people favoured some form of pedestrianisation the present scheme was thought by most to be dangerous.
